Name: Thimphu
Description: The capital and largest city of Bhutan, located in the western part of the country, known for its blend of traditional Bhutanese culture and modern influences.

Name: Phuntsholing
Description: A town located on the southern border with India, serving as an important commercial hub and gateway to Bhutan.

Name: Paro
Description: A valley town in western Bhutan, known for its historic monasteries, including the iconic Tiger s Nest, and its role as an important cultural and tourism destination.

Name: Punakha
Description: A town located in central Bhutan, famous for its historical significance and stunning landscapes, including the Punakha Dzong.

Name: Wangdue Phodrang
Description: A district in central Bhutan, known for its scenic beauty and important landmarks, including the Wangdue Phodrang Dzong.

Name: Trashigang
Description: A town in eastern Bhutan, known as the largest town in the eastern region, with a growing economy and cultural significance.

Name: Samdrup Jongkhar
Description: A border town located in the southeastern part of Bhutan, serving as a key point of entry for trade with India.

Name: Lhuntse
Description: A remote district in northeastern Bhutan, known for its traditional culture, natural beauty, and rural landscapes.
